intro: Pteleopsis diptera, commonly known as the two-winged pteleopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly in regions with moist, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Pteleopsis diptera is often found in woodland and grassland habitats, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
